message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as document summarization. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel attention refinement unit to improve the attention mechanism, which is a common technique used in many NLP tasks. 

The paper also involves optimization techniques, which could place it in the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper deals with information retrieval and text mining, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper proposes a global variance loss to optimize attention distributions, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it involves neural network optimization techniques.
